bibl.title: Sam Hop v. H.F. Bucher. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court 3rd Judicial District holding terms at Port Townsend

body.p: In the District Court of 3rd Judicial District, holding terms at Port Townsend
In the matter of the application of Sam Hop and Chinese subjects, for writs of Habeas Corpus.

Where the reading and filing of the petition of Sam Hop and Ali Tek signed and verified by on behalf of Sam Hop and Ali Tek whereby it appears he is illegaly restrained of his liberty by one H.F. Bucher of the city of Port Townsend, Jefferson County Wash Ty. and stating wherein the illegality consists, from which it appears to me that a writ of Habeas Corpus ought to issue, it is ordered that a Writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of and under the seal of the District Court of the 3rd Judicial Dist. of Washington Ty. holding terms at Port Townsend, directed to the said H.F. Bucher commanding him to have the bodiesy of the said Sam Hop

and Ali Tek before me in the Court room of the said Court on the 29th day of August 1885 9 oclock a.m. of that day to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Sam Hop and Ali Tek togegher together with the time and cause of his detention, and that he have then and there the said writ.
In the matter of the petition of for writ of Habeas Corpus
